name: Hellmann's/Best Foods
description: Offers a variety including Real Mayonnaise, Light Mayonnaise, and Organic options.

name: Kraft
description: Known for Real Mayo, Deluxe Mayonnaise, and Extra Heavy Mayonnaise.

name: Duke's
description: Features Real Mayonnaise and various flavored options like Bacon & Tomato.

name: Kewpie
description: Famous for its Japanese-style mayonnaise, known for its umami flavor.

name: Blue Plate
description: Provides Real Mayonnaise, Light Mayonnaise, and Spicy Mayonnaise.

name: Primal Kitchen
description: Offers avocado oil-based mayonnaises that are often vegan.

name: Sir Kensington's
description: Known for its Classic Mayonnaise and several flavored varieties.

name: Follow Your Heart
description: Features vegan mayonnaise options.

name: Miracle Whip
description: Although not technically mayonnaise, it is a popular mayonnaise-like dressing.

name: Maguro
description: One of the most popular toppings, often served as raw or seared tuna. It can be further classified into parts like akami (lean part) and otoro (fatty belly).

name: Sake
description: Fresh salmon is another favorite for nigiri, known for its rich flavor and smooth texture.

name: Ebi
description: Usually boiled or steamed, ebi is often served with the tail intact for presentation.

name: Tamago
description: A sweet, layered omelet is sliced and served on top of rice, often enjoyed as a milder option.

name: Unagi
description: Grilled eel glazed with a sweet soy-based sauce. It's typically served cooked, making it a safe option for those who prefer not to eat raw fish.

name: Ikura
description: Salmon roe is served on rice, providing a burst of flavor with each bite. The bright orange color adds visual appeal.

name: Ika
description: Thinly sliced raw squid has a slightly chewy texture and is often served with a touch of wasabi.

name: Hirame
description: Thinly sliced flounder has a delicate flavor and is often appreciated for its texture.

name: Aji
description: Served as a whole fish, it has a slightly stronger taste and is typically marinated before serving.

name: Tako
description: Boiled octopus is sliced thinly and served, often with a slight chewiness.

name: Hotate
description: Sweet, tender scallops are often served raw, showcasing their delicate flavor.

name: Kampachi
description: A rich, flavorful fish that is appreciated for its fatty texture.
